comments:
Eclipse 20020321
JVM Sun 1.3.1
OS: Win2k
CVS connection extssh to a solaris server 1.11.1p1

I just installed the new stable build with a clean workspace
I added a couple of java projects where the directory is on a network drive 
(but the workspace is still on the local drive)
I was able to download at least one project from the CVS repository to reside 
on my local hard drive.

I created a new simple project where the location was on the network drive.

I then wanted to update the CVS server with changes I made to the project.  
There was already a project by the same name in the CVS repository.

I recieve the following error:
Error retrieving remote resource tree for /Management. Parent is not managed by 
CVS.

>>I added a couple of java projects where the directory is on a network drive 
(but the workspace is still on the local drive)

Just to ensure I understand, I assume what you meant to say was that your 
workspace (the place where your project directories and .metadata live) is on 
the network drive but your Eclipse install (plugins, JRE, eclipse.exe, etc.) is 
on your local drive?

Also, are you sure there are no latency issues with your network?  I am 
thinking in particular of us not reading CVS folders we just read.

Finally, are all the rights right?

>>Just to ensure I understand, I assume what you meant to say was that your 
>>workspace (the place where your project directories and .metadata live) is on 
>>the network drive but your Eclipse install (plugins, JRE, eclipse.exe, etc.) 
is 
>>on your local drive?
Assume C: is a local drive and Z: is a network drive
eclipse is installed in C:\eclipse
my workspace is on c:\workspace
my project directories are on z:\workspace\PROJECT_NAME

I found that if my workspace was on the network drive, then eclipse would be 
slower than if the workspace is on the local drive.  I assume that this is 
because the metadata is being accessed fairly frequently for reads/updates and 
that my network is not as fast as my disk.


>>Also, are you sure there are no latency issues with your network?  I am 
>>thinking in particular of us not reading CVS folders we just read.

The network is reasonably fast. Theoretically it is a 100Mb connected directly 
to a W2k server which accesses the filesystem via samba over a gigabit ethernet.
It doesn't feel as fast as this sounds, but there are no long delays.

>>Finally, are all the rights right?
Well, yes. Otherwise I shouldn't be able to move projects from my local drive 
to my network drive (thanks for the tip). And with the previous VCM I could 
add/delete/modify any of the files. I do have several symlinks on the network 
drive, but all of the directories that they point to I have read/write 
permission in.

Sorry for the obvious questions (its our usual checklist with these kinds of 
bug reports).

I don't understand the steps you took. Instead of using 'downloaded' or other 
terms not in the UI please tell me the exact steps including the menu item 
names. If a project already exists in the CVS repository the share wizard would 
not let you continue and your project would never get assigned the CVS nature.
Is this still a problem with the latest build?
Closing as fixed, pls reopen if still a problem,
